response_metadata.response_text:
{
"overview": "The purpose of this measure is to, beginning January 1, 2026, require that pharmacy technicians be registered with and obtain a certificate of registration issued by the Board of Pharmacy (HB72_CD1). This measure will also impose a duty on pharmacists-in-charge to report violations by registered pharmacy technicians to the Board of Pharmacy (HB72_CD1). Additionally, the measure specifies that supervising registered pharmacists are responsible for the actions of registered pharmacy technicians and pharmacy interns (HB72_CD1).",
"appropriations": "",
"assumptions_and_methodology": "",
"agency_impact": "",
"economic_impact": "",
"policy_impact": "Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by deleting the $20 registration fee for pharmacy technicians and changing its effective date to upon approval (HB72_CD1). The Committee also made technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style (HB72_CD1).",
"revenue_sources": "A proposed revenue source has been removed, as the Committee on Conference amended the measure by \"Deleting the $20 registration fee for pharmacy technicians (HB72_CD1)\".",
"six_year_fiscal_implications": "",
"operating_revenue_impact": "There will be no impact to operating revenue as a result of the measure \"Deleting the $20 registration fee for pharmacy technicians (HB72_CD1)\".",
"capital_expenditure_impact": "",
"fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "",
"updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "This fiscal note is updated based on the Conference Committee Report, which recommends final passage of H.B. No. 72, H.D. 2, S.D. 1, C.D. 1. The most significant amendment is the deletion of the $20 registration fee for pharmacy technicians, which eliminates a previously anticipated revenue source (HB72_CD1). Additionally, the measure's effective date has been changed to upon approval (HB72_CD1)."
}

sentence_attributions.sentence:
{
"overview": "The purpose of this measure is to, beginning January 1, 2026, require that pharmacy technicians be registered with and obtain a certificate of registration issued by the Board of Pharmacy (HB72_CD1)
This measure will also impose a duty on pharmacists-in-charge to report violations by registered pharmacy technicians to the Board of Pharmacy (HB72_CD1)
Additionally, the measure specifies that supervising registered pharmacists are responsible for the actions of registered pharmacy technicians and pharmacy interns (HB72_CD1)

",
"appropriations": "",
"assumptions_and_methodology": "",
"agency_impact": "",
"economic_impact": "",
"policy_impact": "Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by deleting the $20 registration fee for pharmacy technicians and changing its effective date to upon approval (HB72_CD1)
The Committee also made technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style (HB72_CD1)

",
"revenue_sources": "A proposed revenue source has been removed, as the Committee on Conference amended the measure by \"Deleting the $20 registration fee for pharmacy technicians (HB72_CD1)\"

",
"six_year_fiscal_implications": "",
"operating_revenue_impact": "There will be no impact to operating revenue as a result of the measure \"Deleting the $20 registration fee for pharmacy technicians (HB72_CD1)\"

",
"capital_expenditure_impact": "",
"fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "",
"updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "This fiscal note is updated based on the Conference Committee Report, which recommends final passage of H

B. No. 72, H. D. 2, S. D. 1, C. D. 1. The most significant amendment is the deletion of the $20 registration fee for pharmacy technicians, which eliminates a previously anticipated revenue source (HB72_CD1)
Additionally, the measure's effective date has been changed to upon approval (HB72_CD1)

chunk_details.chunk_text: CCR182 CONFERENCE COMMITTEE REP. NO. 182 Honolulu, Hawaii , 2025 RE: H.B. No. 72 H.D. 2 S.D. 1 C.D. 1 Honorable Nadine K. Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular

D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madam and Sir: Your Committee on Conference on the disagreeing vote of the House of Representatives to the amendments proposed by the Senate in H.B. No. 72, H.D. 2, S.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL

H.B. No. 72, H.D. 2, S.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO PHARMACY," having met, and after full and free discussion, has agreed to recommend and does recommend to the respective Houses the final passage of this bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure

bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure is to: (1) Beginning January 1, 2026, require that pharmacy technicians be registered with and obtain a certificate of registration issued by the Board of Pharmacy; (2) Impose a duty on pharmacists-in-charge to report violations by registered pharmacy technicians to

on pharmacists-in-charge to report violations by registered pharmacy technicians to the Board of Pharmacy; and (3) Specify that supervising registered pharmacists are responsible for the actions of registered pharmacy technicians and pharmacy interns. Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by: (1) Deleting the $20 registration fee for pharmacy

measure by: (1) Deleting the $20 registration fee for pharmacy technicians; (2) Changing its effective date to upon approval; and (3) Making technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. As affirmed by the record of votes of the managers of your Committee on Conference that is

of the managers of your Committee on Conference that is attached to this report, your Committee on Conference is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 72, H.D. 2, S.D. 1, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Final Reading in the form attached hereto as

it pass Final Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 72, H.D. 2, S.D. 1, C.D. 1. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the managers: ON THE PART OF THE SENATE ON THE PART OF THE HOUSE ____________________________ JOY A. SAN BUENAVENTURA Chair ____________________________ GREGG TAKAYAMA Co-Chair ____________________________ JARRETT

A. SAN BUENAVENTURA Chair ____________________________ GREGG TAKAYAMA Co-Chair ____________________________ JARRETT KEOHOKALOLE Co-Chair ____________________________ SCOT Z. MATAYOSHI Co-Chair ____________________________ SUE L. KEOHOKAPU-LEE LOY Co-Chair
